title: South Asian Climate Justice Fellowship 2025
description:
The South Asian Climate Justice Fellowship 2025 is a 3-month hybrid program aimed at empowering young climate advocates across South Asia. The fellowship offers expert-led virtual training on climate justice, environmental governance, and climate finance, as well as group and individual mentorship. Outstanding participants will be selected for a fully funded, in-person Climate Justice Camp in Pokhara, Nepal. This program emphasizes grassroots leadership, community-based solutions, and regional collaboration for climate resilience.

Eligibility:
- Youth aged 18-29 from South Asia
- Passionate about climate justice and community-level climate action
- Grassroots activists, indigenous voices, and youth from marginalized communities are especially encouraged to apply

Benefits:
- Expert mentorship and virtual training on key climate topics
- Peer learning and regional networking
- Opportunity to attend a fully funded in-person Climate Justice Camp in Pokhara, Nepal
- Enhanced skills in climate advocacy and policy engagement
organizer: Worldâ€™s Youth for Climate Justice (WYCJ) Nepal

title: Constellations Fellowship Summer 2025
description:
The Constellations Fellowships are virtual, part-time positions running from June 9, 2025, for 12 to 14 weeks. Fellows will work remotely on various climate-related roles and receive a $1,000 stipend upon successful completion. Each position has specific descriptions and qualifications, which can be found on the fellowship page. Applicants must submit separate applications for each position of interest, including tailored resumes and cover letters.

Eligibility:
- Open to global applicants passionate about climate action
- Specific qualifications vary by position

Benefits:
- $1,000 stipend
- Flexible, part-time virtual engagement
- Professional experience in climate-related fields
- Opportunity to contribute to meaningful global sustainability work.

title: Community Engagement Exchange (CEE) Program 2026
description:
The Community Engagement Exchange (CEE) Program is a year-long transformative leadership program for emerging civil society leaders aged 21â€“27. It includes a three-month U.S.-based practicum at a civil society organization, a Leadership and Civic Engagement Academy, the design and implementation of a Community Engagement Project (CEP), and an exchange where U.S. hosts may visit fellowsâ€™ home communities. 

Eligibility:
- Aged 21-27
- Citizens of eligible countries (e.g., Nepal, India, Kenya, etc.)
- At least 2 years of professional or volunteer experience in civil society/community initiatives
- Committed to returning home to implement a CEP
- Proficient in English and eligible for a U.S. J-1 Visa

Ineligibility includes U.S. citizens/permanent residents, those currently studying or residing outside their home country (except with refugee status), or anyone who hasnâ€™t fulfilled a previous U.S. exchange programâ€™s two-year home residency.

Benefits:
- Fully funded travel, visa, and program costs
- Monthly living stipend during U.S. practicum
- Health insurance coverage
- Professional development and leadership training
- Global network of changemakers

title: SB62 YOUNGO Badge Pool Application
description:
The SB62 YOUNGO Badge Pool Application is now open for the 62nd Session of the Subsidiary Bodies (SB62), to be held from 16â€“26 June 2025 in Bonn, Germany. YOUNGO invites youth to apply for accreditation to attend the UNFCCC negotiation session. This opportunity supports equitable representation of youth globally, prioritizing new and returning members, marginalized genders, and youth from the Global South.

Selection will be based on:
- Understanding of the UNFCCC process
- Prior engagement in youth and environmental advocacy (especially within YOUNGO)
- Plans for meaningful participation at SB62

Important Notes:
- No funding is provided for travel, visa, or accommodation. Selected applicants must self-fund.
- The badge offers accreditation and can serve as a visa support letter, but applicants are responsible for their visa process.
- Recipients must follow all UNFCCC NGO participation guidelines.
- Applicants indemnify YOUNGO and GCT members of any legal or logistical responsibility.

More about the badge policy: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1QJ9MxYpmO6oH-kb1-Q8L1M4dtq4TECv_QUZQCC1mLvs/edit?usp=drivesdk

title: Ecocode COP30 Taskforce Grants
description:
Ecocode is recruiting a dynamic COP30 Taskforce to shape its presence at the 2025 UN Climate Change Conference (COP30) in BelÃ©m, Brazil. Weâ€™re looking for passionate professionals with backgrounds in climate policy, sustainable innovation, business strategy, or public relations. Selected individuals will work remotely in the lead-up and travel with Ecocode to Brazil in Novemberâ€“December 2025.

Participants must secure their own COP30 accreditation (e.g., Blue Zone badges). Ecocode will provide round-trip airfare and a daily stipend, though accommodation and entry passes are the applicant's responsibility. This is an extraordinary opportunity to engage in global climate negotiations, represent a climate-forward organization, and expand your international network.

Open to applicants from all nationalities.
duration: Remote until November 2025, then in-person at COP30 (Novâ€“Dec 2025)

title: Women in Energy Fellowship 2025
description:
The Women in Energy Fellowship, hosted annually by Columbia University's Center on Global Energy Policy, supports early-career women professionals in the energy sector with 3 to 8 years of experience. The program combines in-person learning in New York City with expert-led sessions on energy and climate, skill-building workshops (e.g., public speaking and negotiation), and the creation of a strong peer network. The Summer 2025 cohort builds on a successful pilot with expanded programming and collaborative opportunities. Fellows are expected to present during the Fellowship and commit to in-person participation.

Key Benefits:
- Learn from leading energy and climate experts
- Develop soft skills crucial for leadership
- Expand professional networks and mentoring connections
- Present projects during the fellowship
- Join a growing alumni network of women in energy leadership
organizer: Columbia University Center on Global Energy Policy (Women in Energy Initiative)

title: Youth Food Lab :“ Agrifood Incubation Program 2025
description:
The Youth Food Lab :“ Agrifood Incubation Program is a hybrid incubation program supporting 15 early-stage, youth-led innovations in Nepal's agriculture and food systems. It aims to enhance sustainability, resilience, and inclusive growth through coaching, mentoring, and masterclasses. The program welcomes innovative solutions, especially those related to Indigenous Peoples' Food Systems. One standout finalist will be selected to pitch at the World Food Forum 2025 in Rome, Italy.

Key Benefits:
- Expert mentorship and coaching
- Global and local masterclass participation
- Network access within the global food innovation community
- Pitch opportunity at World Food Forum 2025 in Rome

Eligibility:
- Nepali youth aged 18â€“30
- Prototype-ready startups or piloted agri-innovations
- Youth-led (individuals or teams)
- Commitment to attend both virtual and in-person sessions
organizer: FAO Nepal, King's College, Innovation Kitchen, World Food Forum Nepal Chapter

title: Asia Pacific Youth Environment Forum (APYEF) 2025
description:
The Asia Pacific Youth Environment Forum (APYEF) 2025 is the third regional youth forum organized in alignment with UNEA-7 under the theme: 'Advancing Sustainable Solutions for a Resilient Planet'. The event, taking place on 26 August 2025 in Nadi, Fiji, offers a platform for youth leaders from the Asia-Pacific to engage in capacity building, policy advocacy, and regional collaboration on environmental issues. Outputs from APYEF will contribute to the Regional Consultation Meeting and the Asia-Pacific Youth Roadmap on Sustainability, Environment, and Resilience.

Applicants must be self-funded and able to attend the full forum in person. Preference is given to applicants who can participate in additional regional ministerial meetings following the forum.

Eligibility:
- Youth aged 18â€“35 from Asia-Pacific
- Environmental advocates and youth leaders
- Able to attend in person on 26 August 2025
- Preferably available to attend the entire series of forums through 29 August
organizer: Children and Youth Major Group (CYMG) to UNEP, UNEP Asia-Pacific, University of the South Pacific, Government of Fiji

title: Teicholz Sustainability Scholarship 2025
description:
The Eric Teicholz Sustainability Scholarship, offered by the IFMA Foundation, provides students and young professionals the opportunity to earn the Sustainability Facility ProfessionalÂ® (SFP) credential at no cost. This scholarship supports individuals pursuing careers in facility management or related fields who demonstrate a commitment to sustainability and have financial need.

Eligibility:
- Open to students and young professionals studying or working in facility management or related fields
- Must demonstrate financial need and a strong interest in sustainability in the built environment

Selection Process:
- Reviewed by a committee of FM professionals
- Evaluated on diversity, financial need, and potential impact of the credential
- Scholarship covers all SFP credential fees
- Winners will be announced at World Workplace 2025

title: Bellagio Center Convening Program 2026
description:
The Bellagio Center Convening Program brings together changemaking organizations and leaders for one-week convenings designed to advance solutions that improve lives globally. Each convening supports the development of initiatives across fields like climate, health, equity, and emerging tech. The program seeks proposals that demonstrate clear impact, involve affected populations in the solution design, and are poised for catalytic change.

**Key Criteria:**
- Focus on charitable purpose and underserved communities
- Timely and catalytic opportunity
- Clear, measurable path to impact
- Organizational capacity for planning and execution

Applications are accepted for convenings only (not fellowships or grants), and must be submitted by an organization.

title: Resilience Youth Network Fellowship
description: The Resilience Youth Network Fellowship is a five-week virtual summer program for high school juniors and seniors across the United States, Latin America, and South Asia. Fellows participate in weekly lectures by climate experts, lead discussions, and complete a Capstone Project for publication.

title: Eric Teicholz Sustainability Scholarship
description: The Eric Teicholz Sustainability Scholarship provides free tuition for students and young professionals to earn their Sustainability Facility ProfessionalÂ® (SFP) credential. This assessment-based certificate program equips recipients with practical skills to advance sustainable practices in the built environment.

title: COP30 Simulation Fellowship
description: The COP30 Simulation Fellowship is a certified international program for university students to simulate climate negotiations, collaborate on policy papers, and present youth-driven climate declarations at COP30. With support from global institutions and hosted by The British University in Egypt in collaboration with UNDP Egypt, this fellowship empowers youth to influence real climate outcomes.
organizer: The British University in Egypt (BUE) and UNDP Egypt

title: 2025 NGO Fellowship Program
description: Taiwan AIDâ€™s 2025 NGO Fellowship Program is designed for NGO professionals from South Asia, Southeast Asia, and the Pacific Island region. The program includes a four-day workshop, site visits, a roundtable event, and a three-week placement with a Taiwanese NGO, culminating in a project proposal for future collaboration
organizer: Taiwan Alliance in International Development (Taiwan AID)

title: Joint Japan/World Bank Graduate Scholarship Program (JJ/WBGSP) 2025
description:
The Joint Japan/World Bank Graduate Scholarship Program (JJ/WBGSP) is a fully funded opportunity for citizens of select developing countries with professional experience in development to pursue a masterâ€™s degree at one of 41 participating universities across the U.S., Europe, Africa, Oceania, and Japan. The program supports study in key areas such as economic policy management, infrastructure, and tax policy. Applicants must first secure unconditional admission (except for financial support) to one of the listed masterâ€™s programs to be eligible.

Eligibility:
- Citizen of a World Bank member developing country
- Not hold dual citizenship of any developed country
- At least 3 years of paid development-related work experience after earning a bachelorâ€™s degree (within the past 6 years)
- Currently employed in a full-time, development-related job
- Admitted unconditionally (except for funding) to a participating JJ/WBGSP masterâ€™s program outside the applicantâ€™s country of citizenship and residence

Benefits:
- Full tuition coverage
- Monthly living stipend
- Round-trip airfare and travel allowance
- Health insurance during study period
organizer: World Bank Group & Government of Japan

title: ADB-Japan Scholarship Program (ADB-JSP) 2025
description:
The ADB-Japan Scholarship Program (ADB-JSP) offers around 135 fully funded graduate scholarships annually for students from ADB borrowing member countries to pursue masterâ€™s degrees in economics, business and management, science and technology, and other development-related fields at designated institutions across Asia and the Pacific. The program is designed to build capacity in development and leadership.

Eligibility:
- Citizen of an ADB borrowing member and Japanese ODA scholarship-eligible country
- Not hold dual citizenship of any developed country
- Admitted to an approved masterâ€™s course at a designated institution
- Bachelorâ€™s degree with superior academic record
- Minimum 2 years of full-time professional work experience after undergraduate studies
- Proficient in English (oral and written)
- Under 35 years of age (exceptions possible)
- In good health
- Agree to return and work in home country for at least 2 years post-study
- Not be a staff member or close relative of ADB, its institutions, or the host institution
- Not be currently enrolled in a graduate program

Benefits:
- Full tuition fees
- Monthly subsistence allowance (including housing)
- Books and instructional materials
- Medical insurance
- Travel expenses
- Thesis preparation and special course coverage in select cases
organizer: Asian Development Bank (ADB) & Government of Japan

title: Youth For Climate Hackathon
description: The Youth For Climate Hackathon is a regional initiative by ICLEI South Asia that invites passionate youth to co-create innovative, scalable, and impactful solutions for climate adaptation in South Asian cities. Participants will collaborate with like-minded changemakers to address the climate crisis in urban areas through innovation and teamwork.

title: Summer 2025 FXB Climate Advocates Program
description: The FXB Climate Advocates Program is a virtual summer program that empowers young climate leaders through educational workshops led by specialists from institutions like the FXB Center at Harvard, NYU, Project Drawdown, and Citizens' Climate Lobby. This is a non-financial, skill-building opportunity for youth to gain knowledge and lead local climate initiatives.
organizer: FXB Center for Health and Human Rights at Harvard

title: 2025 Gender Just Climate Solutions Awards
description: The Gender Just Climate Solutions Awards 2025 recognize outstanding projects that promote gender equity and climate action. Hosted by WECF and the Women & Gender Constituency, the awards highlight technological, non-technological, and transformative initiatives that empower women and gender-diverse individuals in climate resilience and justice.
duration: Award and recognition program leading up to COP30

title: "Conservation and Communities Fellowship 2025
description:
The Conservation and Communities Fellowship 2025 is a 7-month hybrid program designed for grassroots conservation leaders from the Global South working at the intersection of biodiversity and community livelihoods. The program includes online and in-person learning, mentorship, leadership development, and technical workshops on fundraising, project design, and evaluation. Fellows will also receive post-fellowship support, seed grants, and access to a global network of peers and professionals. The program runs from 11 November 2025 to 7 May 2026 and requires full participation in all sessions. 

Eligibility:
- Applicants must be from the Global South
- Leaders or project managers in grassroots or civil society organizations
- Focused on biodiversity conservation and community livelihoods
- Must be proficient in English and have stable internet access
- Encouraged: Indigenous people, ethnic minorities, women, LGBTQ+, and people with disabilities

Benefits:
- In-person + online learning experiences
- Mentorship and leadership development
- Technical workshops (fundraising, evaluation, project design)
- Post-fellowship support and seed grants
- Access to a global network of changemakers

title: Global Youth MIDORI platform (GYM) 2025
description: The Global Youth MIDORI platform (GYM) 2025, hosted by UNU-IAS and AEON Environmental Foundation, is a capacity development programme empowering undergraduate youth to develop solutions for sustainability challenges, including climate change and biodiversity loss. The programme includes a 3-day online training, a speech contest, and opportunities for international conference participation such as COP30 in Brazil. Top participants will receive awards and travel opportunities, while all participants are expected to engage in follow-up outreach activities. The programme promotes meaningful youth participation in global environmental dialogues.
organizer: United Nations University Institute for the Advanced Study of Sustainability (UNU-IAS)
